intro: Faba vulgaris var. major, commonly known as the broad bean or fava bean, is a leguminous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces large, flat pods containing 2–4 kidney-shaped seeds, which are rich in protein and nutrients. The plant has trifoliate leaves and a hairy stem, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its edible seeds. The plant also plays a role in nitrogen fixation, enriching the soil through its symbiotic relationship with rhizobia bacteria.
